overview:
This class allows you interact with Cloud Monitoring.

First, install @google-cloud/monitoring with npm:

$ npm install --save @google-cloud/monitoring

If you are running your app on Google Compute Engine, you won't need to worry about supplying connection configuration options to @google-cloud/monitoringâ€” we figure that out for you.

However, if you're running your app elsewhere, you will need to provide project details to authenticate API requests.

Google Cloud Platform

var monitoring = require('@google-cloud/monitoring')();

Elsewhere

var monitoring = require('@google-cloud/monitoring')({ projectId: 'grape-spaceship-123', keyFilename: '/path/to/keyfile.json' });

The full set of options which can be passed to @google-cloud/monitoring are outlined in our Authentication guide.

methods.description:
An object that describes the schema of a {@link MonitoredResource} object using a type name and a set of labels. For example, the monitored resource descriptor for Google Compute Engine VM instances has a type of "gce_instance" and specifies the use of the labels "instance_id" and "zone" to identify particular VM instances.

Different APIs can support different monitored resource types. APIs generally provide a list method that returns the monitored resource descriptors used by the API.

params.name: name
params.description: Optional. The resource name of the monitored resource descriptor: "projects/{project_id}/monitoredResourceDescriptors/{type}" where {type} is the value of the type field in this object and {project_id} is a project ID that provides API-specific context for accessing the type. APIs that do not use project information can use the resource name format "monitoredResourceDescriptors/{type}".

params.name: type
params.description: Required. The monitored resource type. For example, the type "cloudsql_database" represents databases in Google Cloud SQL. The maximum length of this value is 256 characters.

params.name: displayName
params.description: Optional. A concise name for the monitored resource type that might be displayed in user interfaces. It should be a Title Cased Noun Phrase, without any article or other determiners. For example, "Google Cloud SQL Database".

params.name: description
params.description: Optional. A detailed description of the monitored resource type that might be used in documentation.

params.name: labels
params.description:
Required. A set of labels used to describe instances of this monitored resource type. For example, an individual Google Cloud SQL database is identified by values for the labels "database_id" and "zone".

This object should have the same structure as google.api.LabelDescriptor
